\documentclass[]{standalone} 


\pdfcompresslevel=0
\pdfobjcompresslevel=0

%%   
%% Standard package imports        
%%

\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}             % fontencoding - FIRST load fontencoding 
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}          % and only THEN load UTF-8 see https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/13067/
\usepackage{ucs}                     % unicode support
\usepackage{comment}                 %    allows to flag portions of the document using \begin{comment} ... \end{comment}

\usepackage{csquotes}                % quotes
\usepackage{tabto}                   % command \tabto{2cm}
\usepackage[usenames]{color}         % Should load before tcolorbox                  


\usepackage{tcolorbox}



\usepackage{xstring}

%% minted is included dynamically

%%
%% DRAWING and GRAPHICS
%%

\usepackage{tikz}
\usetikzlibrary{trees,positioning}
\usetikzlibrary{fpu}
\usetikzlibrary{arrows.meta,calc,decorations.markings,math}
\usetikzlibrary{intersections}
\usetikzlibrary{positioning,fit}%
\usetikzlibrary{quotes,angles}
\usetikzlibrary{mindmap}%  
\usetikzlibrary{shadows}%                           % needed by mindmaps


\usepackage{qrcode}                                   % defines \qrcode[height=1cm,level=L]{ABCD} level: L M Q H for low medium ... quality
\usepackage[percent]{overpic}                         % wrote some text directly over a picture, see 
                                                      % https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/20792/how-to-superimpose-latex-on-a-picture

\usepackage{pgfplots}
\pgfplotsset{compat=newest}
\pgfplotsset{trig format plots=rad}                   % trigonometry MUST clearly be done in radiants 

\tikzset{trig format=rad}%      pgfplotsset only affects plots, also need this for all of tikz

%%\usepackage{tikz-uml}  %% UNKNOWN 

\def\tikzrad{\pgfplotsset{trig format plots=rad}\tikzset{trig format=rad}}
\def\tikzdeg{\pgfplotsset{trig format plots=deg}\tikzset{trig format=deg}}

%% TODO: what is this for ??
\newcommand*{\info}[4][16.3]{%
  \node [ annotation, #3, scale=0.65, text width = #1em, inner sep = 2mm ] at (#2) {%
  %\vspace*{-0.5em}%
  \def\BL{\list{$\bullet$}{\topsep=0pt\itemsep=0pt\parsep=0pt\parskip=0pt\labelwidth=8pt\leftmargin=8pt\itemindent=0pt\labelsep=2pt}%
    \def\EL{\endlist}%\baselineskip12pt%
  }%
 \par\nointerlineskip  #4%
  };
}

%%
%% MATHEMATICS
%%
\usepackage[fleqn]{amsmath}          % ams math package with flushed left equations
\usepackage{amssymb,amscd}           % math symbols
\usepackage{mathtools}               % fixes deficiencies in amsmath
\usepackage[all]{xy}
\usepackage{bussproofs}              % proof trees

%%
%% TWEAK amsmath macro to allow \begin{pmatrix}[1.5] for having more space see https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/14071/how-can-i-increase-the-line-spacing-in-a-matrix
%%
\makeatletter
\renewcommand*\env@matrix[1][\arraystretch]{%
  \edef\arraystretch{#1}%
  \hskip -\arraycolsep
  \let\@ifnextchar\new@ifnextchar
  \array{*\c@MaxMatrixCols c}}
\makeatother

%\input prooftree


%%
%% Include local packages
%%

\input{../local/chc-jpabox.tex}
\input{../local/variants.tex}




\usepackage{ifpdf}%          to be able to detect pdf
\ifpdf{
\pdfcompresslevel=0
\pdfobjcompresslevel=0
%% the following is to get stable builds with the same hash value of the PDF and better control over document privarcy
\pdftrailerid{}             % seed pdf trailer computation with and empty argument for reproducible hash values 
\pdfsuppressptexinfo7       % force pdf driver to omit 1 fullbanner, 2 filename, 4 pagenumber, but leaves info dict intact (for trapped !)
\pdfinfoomitdate1           % force removal of creation and modification dates from PDF file
\pdfpagewidth 15cm
}\else{}\fi

%%
%% Adjusting the lengths
%%

\marginparsep   0cm
\marginparwidth 0cm
\headsep        0cm
\headheight     0cm

\pagestyle{empty}


\setlength{\mathindent}{1cm}
%\makeatletter
%\setlength\@mathmargin{100pt}
%\makeatother


\def\chcdisplayskipadjust{% 
  \setlength{\abovedisplayskip}{4pt}%
  \setlength{\belowdisplayskip}{4pt}%
  \setlength{\abovedisplayshortskip}{4pt}%
  \setlength{\belowdisplayshortskip}{4pt}%
}%

\let\chcoldselectfont\selectfont%
\def\selectfont{%
  \chcoldselectfont%
  \chcdisplayskipadjust%
}%
\chcdisplayskipadjust%


\def\myInitialize{%   needed for initializations to be done after begin{document} which are taken out by the precompilation process
  \parindent 0pt
  \parskip 0.25cm
  \chcdisplayskipadjust
  \initializeVariants
}


%%
%% HYPERREF
%%
\usepackage[hyphens,obeyspaces,spaces]{url}  % must be loaded before hyperref
\usepackage[
  colorlinks,
  hyperfootnotes=true,    % footnote marks as links
  unicode=true,           % https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/10555/hyperref-warning-token-not-allowed-in-a-pdf-string
  breaklinks=true,         % allow to break links
  hypertexnames=true
]{hyperref}

%%
%% BELOW configures the line breaking algorithm of the url package.
%% DO NOT TOUCH since an additional blank at the wron place may break the algo
%%
\makeatletter
\def\UrlBreaks{\do\.\do\@\do\\\do\/\do\!\do\_\do\|\do\;\do\>\do\]%
  \do\)\do\,\do\?\do\'\do+\do\=\do\#%
  \do A\do B\do C\do D\do E\do F\do G\do H\do I\do J\do K\do L\do M%
  \do N\do O\do P\do Q\do R\do S\do T\do U\do V\do W\do X\do Y\do Z%
  \do a\do b\do c\do d\do e\do f\do g\do h\do i\do j\do k\do l\do m%
  \do n\do o\do p\do q\do r\do s\do t\do u\do v\do w\do x\do y\do z%
  \do 0\do 1\do 2\do 3\do 4\do 5\do 6\do 7\do 8\do 9\do\:%
  \do\.\do\@\do\\\do\/\do\!\do\_\do\|\do\;\do\>\do\]%
  \do\)\do\,\do\?\do\&\do\'\do+\do\=\do\#}%
%\def\UrlBigBreaks{\do\:\do@url@hyp\do\/}%
\def\UrlNoBreaks{}
%\def\UrlOrds{\do\*\do\-\do\~\do\'\do\"\do\-\do\/\do\e}%
\makeatother









\renewcommand{\thempfootnote}{\arabic{mpfootnote}}%    forces footnotes in standalone class to be numeric


%%
%% LOCALIZATION
%%  
%\usepackage[shorthands=off,german]{babel}%  localization; MUST turn off 
% shorthands due to an interference with some xypic features



%%
%% ENUMERATION and ITEMIZATION
%%

\usepackage[inline]{enumitem}

%% Configuring enumitem
%   CAVE: 1) the \setlist global values for a single list must be defined in a SINGLE \setlist command as they otherwise get overwritten by defaults again
%         2) the settings do not carry over to \newlist defined custom lists
%         3) for the starred inline versions the settings are carried over from the non-starred to the starred versions
%         4) for \newlist defined custom lists the settings do not carry over from the non-starred to the starred versions
%         SIGH !

\setlist{itemjoin={\hspace{0.5cm}}}%                     bit of space as joiner for the inline version

\def\enumerateWithDots{
  \setlist[enumerate]{
    partopsep=1.0\parskip,  % separation added when the preceding is a paragraph
    topsep=-0.5\parskip,    % separation added when the preceding is only a line with no paragraph ending
    itemsep=0cm,
    label=\textbf{(\arabic*)},
    after={\vspace*{1.5\parskip}}
  }
}

\def\enumerateWithBrackets{
  \setlist[enumerate]{
    partopsep=1.0\parskip,  % separation added when the preceding is a paragraph
    topsep=-0.5\parskip,    % separation added when the preceding is only a line with no paragraph ending
    itemsep=0cm,
    label=\textbf{(\arabic*)},
    after={\vspace*{1.5\parskip}}
  }
}

\enumerateWithBrackets


%% define enumerated as dotted version should we nevertheless need it.
\newlist{enumerated}{enumerate}{3}\setlist[enumerated]{topsep=0pt,itemsep=0cm,label=\textbf{\arabic*.}}  
\newlist{enumerated*}{enumerate*}{3}\setlist[enumerated*]{topsep=0pt,itemsep=0cm,label=\textbf{\arabic*.}} % need that since for custom lists the * automatism does not work

\setlist[itemize]{
  partopsep=1.0\parskip,
  topsep=-0.5\parskip,
  itemsep=0cm
}

\setlist[description]{itemindent=-1.5em, labelsep=0pt,partopsep=\parskip,topsep=-\parskip}



%%
%% TABLES and ARRAYS
%%

\usepackage{array}%                       load the new array package

\arraycolsep=3.0pt%                       adds to the separation of array columns
\def\arraystretch{1.2}%                   increase the distance between rows of an array

\usepackage{adjustbox}%   used for alignment https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/127056/vertical-alignment-of-graphic-and-tabular

\usepackage{marginnote}
\def\mymarg#1{\hspace*{-6cm}\marginnote{#1}}






%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%% FONTS
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%\usepackage{concmath}
%\usepackage[OT1]{fontenc}
%\usepackage{txfonts}

\usepackage{stix}                  % needed for \operp and similar symbols
\usepackage{stmaryrd}              % needed for \bigsqcap
\usepackage{fontawesome}           % make fontawesome with some additional symbols available, for example \faTV etc
\usepackage{wasysym}               % some symbols
\usepackage{eurosym}               % euro symbol



%%
%% SHORTCUTS
%%
\def\be{\begin{equation}}
\def\ee{\end{equation}}



% add shortcut for roman literals
\makeatletter
\newcommand{\rmnum}[1]{\romannumeral #1}
\newcommand{\Rmnum}[1]{\expandafter\@slowromancap\romannumeral #1@}
\makeatother



\def\proof#1#2#3{\prooftree #1 \justifies #2 \thickness=0.04em \using #3 \endprooftree}




\usepackage{soul}                                     % defines strikeout markup   \st{strike out}


%%%
%%% SYMBOLS
%%%



%% MediaWiki:ParsifalInclude/LaTeXSymbols


\newcommand\independent{\protect\mathpalette{\protect\independenT}{\perp}}
\def\independenT#1#2{\mathrel{\rlap{$#1#2$}\mkern2mu{#1#2}}}


\def\vv#1{\overrightarrow{#1}} 
\def\vvplus{\vec{+}}

\def\commutes{\leftrightarrow}



\def\with{\|}

\def\leaves{\spadesuit}                     % Leaves of a tree etc...
\def\interleave{ \mid \mid \mid }   


\def\con{ \mbox{\^{ }}}                     % Concatenation
\def\sts#1{\stackrel{#1}{\longrightarrow}}  % State Transition System
\def\stss#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_*} % with a star
\def\stsp#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_+} % with a plus
\def\stsc#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_\circ} % with a circle
\def\stsh#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_h} % with a h
\def\pre#1{ {^\bullet #1} }                 % preset in Petri Nets
\def\post#1{ {#1 ^ \bullet} }               % postset in Petri Nets
\def\Me{\mbox{Me}}                          % Me (X,Y) Symbol
\def\bottom{\bot}
\def\with{\mid}

\def\error{\dagger}                          % error symbol error algebras
\def\im{{\cal I}}                            % image of a partial function
\def\nin{\not\in}



\def\negil{\kern-.13em }
\def\negir{\kern-.08em }
\def\LB{[\negil[}
\def\RB{]\negir]}

\def\1{\mbox{{\bf 1}}}
\def\0{\mbox{{\bf 0}}}
\def\T{\mbox{{\bf T}}}
\def\F{\mbox{{\bf F}}}

%%
%% SETS and FUNCTIONS
%%

\def\N{{\Bbb N}}
\def\Q{{\Bbb Q}}
\def\Z{{\Bbb Z}}
\def\K{{\Bbb K}}
\def\R{{\Bbb R}}
\def\C{{\Bbb C}}


%%
%% Specific mathematical arrows
%%

\def\pto{\rightharpoonup}            % partial function:  f: A \pto B
\def\inclusion{\hookrightarrow}      % inclusion, or more general: injective function   f: A \inclusion B

\def\ito{\hookrightarrow}        % inclusion function
\def\pto{\leadsto}               % partially defined function


\def\lins{{\text{\bf Lin}_s}}    % stetige lineare Abbildungen

\def\tr{\text{\bf Tr}}           % spur operator
\def\ker{\text{\bf Kern}}        % Kernel of a linear map
\def\im{\text{\bf Im}}           % Image of a linear map
\def\eig{\text{\bf Eig}}         % Eigenspace of a linear map

\def\norm#1{\| #1 \|}            % norm

%%
%% Pseudocode
%%
 
\def\tIF{\mbox{\tt \ if }}
\def\tTHEN{\mbox{\tt \ then }}
\def\tELSE{\mbox{\tt \ else }}
\def\tFI{\mbox{\tt \ fi }}
\def\tWHILE{\mbox{\tt \ while }}
\def\tDO{\mbox{\tt \ do }}
\def\tREPEAT{\mbox{\tt \ repeat }}
\def\tUNTIL{\mbox{\tt \ until }}

%% 
%% Category Theory
%% 
\def\M{{\frak M}}                       % Morphisms of a category
\def\O{{\frak O}}                       % Objects of a category

\def\codom{\mbox{\textbf{Codom}}}       % Codomain
\def\dom{\mbox{\textbf{Dom}}}           % Domain
\def\Hom{\mbox{\textbf{Hom}}}           % Hom functor

\def\hto{\twoheadrightarrow}
\def\htot{\rightarrowtail}
\def\smallbox{[\hspace*{-0.02cm}]}      % Non-deterministic choice in guarded command language

\def\clolli{{\>\mathbin\multimap\>}}
\def\illolc{{\>\mathbin{\circ\! -}\>}}

\def\before{\mathbin\succeq} 
\def\prebefore{\mathbin{\vec{\succ}}}
\def\extendsto{\mathbin\trianglerighteq}
\def\extendstoim{\mathbin{\vec{\triangleright}}}


\def\trans{\longrightarrow}
\def\transa#1{\stackrel{#1}{\trans}}
\def\transb#1#2{\stackrel{#1}{\trans_#2}}

\def\proof#1#2#3{\prooftree #1 \justifies #2 \thickness=0.04em \using #3 \endprooftree}

\def\entails{\vdash}


\def\tbone#1{\hbox to 5cm{#1}}

\def\THEN{\Rightarrow}
\def\IFF{\Leftrightarrow}



%%%
%%% LEGACY STUFF
%%%
\newcounter{myc}
\newenvironment{mitemize}%
  {\begin{list}{\arabic{myc}.}{\usecounter{myc}\setlength{\topsep}{0pt}}%
    \setlength{\itemsep}{0pt}%
    \setlength{\parskip}{\parskip}}%

\newenvironment{menumerate}%
  {\begin{list}{\arabic{myc}.}{\usecounter{myc}\setlength{\topsep}{0pt}}%
    \setlength{\itemsep}{0pt}%
    \setlength{\parskip}{\parskip}}%
  {\end{list}}  
%%%
%%%  END OF TWEAK ITEMIZATIONS
%%%

\def\ubf#1{\underline{\textbf{#1}}}

%%
%% SPACING MACROS
%%

\def\tab{\hspace*{0.7cm}}
\def\n{\break}

\def\up{\vspace*{-\parskip}}          % go up one parskip

\def\mleft{\hspace*{-\mathindent}}    % go left one mathindent space
\def\mright{\hspace*{\mathindent}}    % go right one mathindent space

\def\qquad{\quad\quad}                % double quad
\def\qqquad{\quad\quad\quad}          % triple quad
\def\qqqauad{\quad\quad\quad\quad}    % quadruple quad

%%
%% STRUCTURAL MACROS
%%

\def\title#1{\textbf{\large #1}}

This page is a system page. It controls what is shown in the Categories portion of the sidebar. The contents of this page must conform to the following rules: * The page contains a single <pre> ... </pre> area. * This area contains a JSON data string of type array. * The array contains objects of one of the following types: ** {"root": , "depth": } ** {"name": } ** Every object may contain an optional "style" key whose value is a CSS string. ** Every object may contain an optional "classname" field whose value refers to a class name known to the system 
[
  {"root": "Root", "depth":4},
  {"name": "Example", "style": "color:red;"},
  {"name": "Testpage", "style": "color:green;"}
]

<amsmath style="border:10px solid green;"> 921iihj kjh ujkWe6697 i m a sdf ke a meas urement and get a r esu lt $\omega$. We now assume we can talk of an object with the property $\omega$. We cannota say that the object is (or is in the state) $\omega$ as this description might not be precise enough in the sense that the object might have additional properties as well (The color red is an insufficient characterization of an object). We have the fantasy that a sufficient number of properties will uniquely describe an object (This fantasy might not be true). We used language to assign the property to the object but we should rather have used language which assigns the property to the relation of both, the measurement device and the object. And we should not ignore that, in addition to measurement device and object there is also a certain rest in the universe. In the end, we should talk about the property being connected to the measurement device, the object and the rest of the universe. However, it is more convenient, at least in the beginning, to assume that the property belongs to the object alone and take the journey from there. Also,lkj we must admit that there are observations (Hon Mandel dip) and theories (particle number operator not always precisely defined in Fock space) which make it difficult to talk about well-defined objects, of which we have the fantasy that they can be identified, and even if they do not carry identity that the at least could be counted in numbers of a kind.
We make the observation: If we measure a property twice immediately after each other leaving no time for development in between, we get the same result. This might not be the case for every measurement (there are measuremetns for which this is not true and where we describe the measurement as an interaction which changes the object in a way and there are measurements which cannot be made twice in a row as, for example, they destroy the measured object by the very act of observation -- at least that is how we describe the situations in these cases), but at least we can assume this for a class of ideal measurements.
Under this assumption: After the measurement we talk about the property of the object in a precise manner in the sense that a repeated measurement leads to the same result.
So, how would we describe the object before the measurement?
Assume we make the observation, that an object may lead to different measurement results. We find: When we measure (different) objects of a certain kind of which we believe we know no difference (short of knowing somehow that they are different), why would they lead to different measurement results.
a Even worse: We assumed that we knew a property after the measurement. So we know the object as such.
We can describe this as: One property is still missing which we did not measure in that measurement (for example we measured color and not smell) and if we had measured it we would have realized that the object is indeed different. We can describe this as: Before the measurement the object did not have the property we measured (it was imprinted by the measurement). Before the measurement the object had that property only to a certain degree, and for some reason the measurement process selected this and not that aspect of the property. </amsmath>

== Parsifal Cheat Sheet == == Editor == If the editor frame window is focused, adjust the font size of the editor using Cmd + or Cmd - without resizing the rest of the browser. === Attributes === ==== Collapse ==== ==== Continuation ==== Situation: We want to split TeX text into several smaller portions. Advantages of this are: * Faster preview * Smaller unit of error and unit of editing * Seperate edit link For the presentation, there can be several scenarios: * Separation: We want a bit of markup which lets the reader see that there are two different portions of text. * Continuation: We do not want to indicate this separation into two different portions of text. The second portion should be a seamless continuation of the first text. Nevertheless there should be a possibility for the reader to recognize the two parts and to invoke edit links and similar actions for the two parts. [[Category:DanteInitialContents]]

== Dante Links == * Provides a possibility to add attributes to links. * Ensures that links (A-elements) with target ** _window open in a separate window, next to the browser, of similar size ** _side open in an 800x800 window left on the screen.
* Provide markup for external links which open in a separate window [https://www.w3c.org W3C \w] as opposed to [https://www.w3c.org W3C]
== Dante Tree ==
* A shift-click on to a Category link opens the category window as seperate popup window in small size and on the left of the screen. This proved helpful for quick deploy of a category window as an overview.
* A shift-click on a link into a portal heading opens an edit window for that portal content. [[Category:DanteInitialContents]]

Window * [https://blog.fefe.de \w] * [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe \w] Side * [https://blog.fefe.de \s] * [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe \s] '''Example''' * [[Main Page || doub]] * [[Main Page || doub]] * [[Main Page \| doub]] * [[Main Page \| doub]] '''Example''' * [[Main Page ¦ style=color:green;]] * [[Main Page ¦ style=color:green;]] '''Example''' * [[Help:Demo for DanteLinks ¦ style=color:green;]] * [[Help:Demo for DanteLinks ¦ style=color:green;]] '''Example:''' Adding style attributes to an external link via broken pipe symbol * [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe ¦ style=color:green;] produces * [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe ¦ style=color:green;] '''Example:''' Adding target attribute _blank to an external link opens it in a new tab * [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe ¦ target=_blank ] produces: * [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe ¦ target=_blank ] For use in sidebars only: There is a special class dexternal which can be used to append an external link symbol to link. In the sidebar links which otherwise are external will not show the symbol external. This is as we need query extensions for a number of links in the sidebar and this needs fullurl as parser and this causes the parser to understand the link as external in every case. Therefore we turned this thingie off in sidebar until we find a smart fix for this. [[Main Page]] And here [[Main Page]] some text [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe] to see the distances when rendering in text. == Requirements == * We always want to see where a link goes (internal or external) * We always want to know where a link opens (same tab, new tab, new window) * We want to allow the user to open the link where he wants to (same tab, new tab, new window) * We want to force-open some links in specific modes (same tab, new tab, new window) when the user only clicks normally. == All Link Types ==
Internal[[Main Page]][[Main Page]]
Piped[[Main Page|Hauptseite]][[Main Page|Hauptseite]]
External numbered[https://blog.fefe.de][https://blog.fefe.de]
External text[https://blog.fefe.de Fefe][https://blog.fefe.de Fefe]
External barehttps://blog.fefe.dehttps://blog.fefe.de
[[Main Page]]s [https://blog.fefe.de Fefe] [[Murundai\w]] [https://blog.fefe.de Hurundai\w] [[Pipetrick (computing)|Pipetrick]] [[:Category:Root]] [[Category:DanteInitialContents]]

revision.comment: /* Why is this called DanteWiki? */
revision.text:
== FAQ ==
=== Why is this called DanteWiki? === The thought of writing done what one has understood dates back to Dante:
"O mente, che scrivesti ciò ch’io vidi" (Dante, Inferno II, 8)
"O Gedächtnis, das geschrieben, was ich erkannte" (own translation)
This thought has also been described in a letter of Nicolo Machiavelli to Francesco Vettori, florentinian ambassador in Rome. We cite it here according to Niccolo Machiavelli, Der Fürst. Suhrkamp Verlag, 2016:
<poem> Und weil Dante sagt, es gebe keine Wissenschaft ohne die Aufzeichnung dessen, was man begriffen hat – so habe ich das notiert, was ich bei dem Gespräch mit Ihnen als das Wesentliche festhielt, und ein kleines Werk über Fürstentümer verfaßt, worin ich mich so weit wie möglich in die Gedanken über dieses Thema vertiefe und erörtere, was Herrschaft ist, welche Arten es davon gib, wie man sie erwirbt und erhält und warum man sie verliert. </poem>
Or, for short:
"[E]s [gibt] keine Wissenschaft ohne die Aufzeichnung dessen, was man begriffen hat."
"There is no science without a record of what one has understood" (own translation)
That's why I call this Wiki system a DanteWiki.
=== What does the logo show? === The logo shows a painting made by Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio in 1607. It depicts Saint Jerome of Stridon, who is best known for his translations of the Bible into Latin. it here serves as the symbol of a scientist, philosopher and thinker. Saint Jerome is alone, remote from the distractions of the world, focused alone on putting down his thoughts. The skull on his table reminds us of the mortality of man and the volatility of his thoughts. It thus challenges us to write down our thoughts.
The logo thus reflexts my core motives when creating this system.
=== What is the relation to MediaWiki? === None.
I did not want to build this system completely from scratch. MediaWiki was the software which contained most of the necessary base functionality and was open for further development due to its open license model. I will try to keep DanteWiki as close to MediaWiki as possible to ease maintenence and bug fixing.
=== What is the relation to WikiPedia? === None.
While WikiPedia is a very interesting project, I do not subscribe to the objectivist perspective on which it seems to be grounded. In particular - in my opinion - the neutral point of view goal of WikiPedia cannot be achieved for a number of linguistic reasons and should not be aimed for due to a number of philosophic reasons.
DanteWiki follows different goals and guidelines.

\documentclass[]{standalone} 


\pdfcompresslevel=0
\pdfobjcompresslevel=0

%%   
%% Standard package imports        
%%

\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}             % fontencoding - FIRST load fontencoding 
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}          % and only THEN load UTF-8 see https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/13067/
\usepackage{ucs}                     % unicode support
\usepackage{comment}                 %    allows to flag portions of the document using \begin{comment} ... \end{comment}

\usepackage{csquotes}                % quotes
\usepackage{tabto}                   % command \tabto{2cm}
\usepackage[usenames]{color}         % Should load before tcolorbox                  


\usepackage{tcolorbox}



\usepackage{xstring}

%% minted is included dynamically

%%
%% DRAWING and GRAPHICS
%%

\usepackage{tikz}
\usetikzlibrary{trees,positioning}
\usetikzlibrary{fpu}
\usetikzlibrary{arrows.meta,calc,decorations.markings,math}
\usetikzlibrary{intersections}
\usetikzlibrary{positioning,fit}%
\usetikzlibrary{quotes,angles}
\usetikzlibrary{mindmap}%  
\usetikzlibrary{shadows}%                           % needed by mindmaps


\usepackage{qrcode}                                   % defines \qrcode[height=1cm,level=L]{ABCD} level: L M Q H for low medium ... quality
\usepackage[percent]{overpic}                         % wrote some text directly over a picture, see 
                                                      % https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/20792/how-to-superimpose-latex-on-a-picture

\usepackage{pgfplots}
\pgfplotsset{compat=newest}
\pgfplotsset{trig format plots=rad}                   % trigonometry MUST clearly be done in radiants 

\tikzset{trig format=rad}%      pgfplotsset only affects plots, also need this for all of tikz

%%\usepackage{tikz-uml}  %% UNKNOWN 

\def\tikzrad{\pgfplotsset{trig format plots=rad}\tikzset{trig format=rad}}
\def\tikzdeg{\pgfplotsset{trig format plots=deg}\tikzset{trig format=deg}}

%% TODO: what is this for ??
\newcommand*{\info}[4][16.3]{%
  \node [ annotation, #3, scale=0.65, text width = #1em, inner sep = 2mm ] at (#2) {%
  %\vspace*{-0.5em}%
  \def\BL{\list{$\bullet$}{\topsep=0pt\itemsep=0pt\parsep=0pt\parskip=0pt\labelwidth=8pt\leftmargin=8pt\itemindent=0pt\labelsep=2pt}%
    \def\EL{\endlist}%\baselineskip12pt%
  }%
 \par\nointerlineskip  #4%
  };
}

%%
%% MATHEMATICS
%%
\usepackage[fleqn]{amsmath}          % ams math package with flushed left equations
\usepackage{amssymb,amscd}           % math symbols
\usepackage{mathtools}               % fixes deficiencies in amsmath
\usepackage[all]{xy}
\usepackage{bussproofs}              % proof trees

%%
%% TWEAK amsmath macro to allow \begin{pmatrix}[1.5] for having more space see https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/14071/how-can-i-increase-the-line-spacing-in-a-matrix
%%
\makeatletter
\renewcommand*\env@matrix[1][\arraystretch]{%
  \edef\arraystretch{#1}%
  \hskip -\arraycolsep
  \let\@ifnextchar\new@ifnextchar
  \array{*\c@MaxMatrixCols c}}
\makeatother

%\input prooftree


%%
%% Include local packages
%%

\input{../local/chc-jpabox.tex}
\input{../local/variants.tex}




\usepackage{ifpdf}%          to be able to detect pdf
\ifpdf{
\pdfcompresslevel=0
\pdfobjcompresslevel=0
%% the following is to get stable builds with the same hash value of the PDF and better control over document privarcy
\pdftrailerid{}             % seed pdf trailer computation with and empty argument for reproducible hash values 
\pdfsuppressptexinfo7       % force pdf driver to omit 1 fullbanner, 2 filename, 4 pagenumber, but leaves info dict intact (for trapped !)
\pdfinfoomitdate1           % force removal of creation and modification dates from PDF file
\pdfpagewidth 15cm
}\else{}\fi

%%
%% Adjusting the lengths
%%

\marginparsep   0cm
\marginparwidth 0cm
\headsep        0cm
\headheight     0cm

\pagestyle{empty}


\setlength{\mathindent}{1cm}
%\makeatletter
%\setlength\@mathmargin{100pt}
%\makeatother


\def\chcdisplayskipadjust{% 
  \setlength{\abovedisplayskip}{4pt}%
  \setlength{\belowdisplayskip}{4pt}%
  \setlength{\abovedisplayshortskip}{4pt}%
  \setlength{\belowdisplayshortskip}{4pt}%
}%

\let\chcoldselectfont\selectfont%
\def\selectfont{%
  \chcoldselectfont%
  \chcdisplayskipadjust%
}%
\chcdisplayskipadjust%


\def\myInitialize{%   needed for initializations to be done after begin{document} which are taken out by the precompilation process
  \parindent 0pt
  \parskip 0.25cm
  \chcdisplayskipadjust
  \initializeVariants
}


%%
%% HYPERREF
%%
\usepackage[hyphens,obeyspaces,spaces]{url}  % must be loaded before hyperref
\usepackage[
  colorlinks,
  hyperfootnotes=true,    % footnote marks as links
  unicode=true,           % https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/10555/hyperref-warning-token-not-allowed-in-a-pdf-string
  breaklinks=true,         % allow to break links
  hypertexnames=true
]{hyperref}

%%
%% BELOW configures the line breaking algorithm of the url package.
%% DO NOT TOUCH since an additional blank at the wron place may break the algo
%%
\makeatletter
\def\UrlBreaks{\do\.\do\@\do\\\do\/\do\!\do\_\do\|\do\;\do\>\do\]%
  \do\)\do\,\do\?\do\'\do+\do\=\do\#%
  \do A\do B\do C\do D\do E\do F\do G\do H\do I\do J\do K\do L\do M%
  \do N\do O\do P\do Q\do R\do S\do T\do U\do V\do W\do X\do Y\do Z%
  \do a\do b\do c\do d\do e\do f\do g\do h\do i\do j\do k\do l\do m%
  \do n\do o\do p\do q\do r\do s\do t\do u\do v\do w\do x\do y\do z%
  \do 0\do 1\do 2\do 3\do 4\do 5\do 6\do 7\do 8\do 9\do\:%
  \do\.\do\@\do\\\do\/\do\!\do\_\do\|\do\;\do\>\do\]%
  \do\)\do\,\do\?\do\&\do\'\do+\do\=\do\#}%
%\def\UrlBigBreaks{\do\:\do@url@hyp\do\/}%
\def\UrlNoBreaks{}
%\def\UrlOrds{\do\*\do\-\do\~\do\'\do\"\do\-\do\/\do\e}%
\makeatother









\renewcommand{\thempfootnote}{\arabic{mpfootnote}}%    forces footnotes in standalone class to be numeric


%%
%% LOCALIZATION
%%  
%\usepackage[shorthands=off,german]{babel}%  localization; MUST turn off 
% shorthands due to an interference with some xypic features



%%
%% ENUMERATION and ITEMIZATION
%%

\usepackage[inline]{enumitem}

%% Configuring enumitem
%   CAVE: 1) the \setlist global values for a single list must be defined in a SINGLE \setlist command as they otherwise get overwritten by defaults again
%         2) the settings do not carry over to \newlist defined custom lists
%         3) for the starred inline versions the settings are carried over from the non-starred to the starred versions
%         4) for \newlist defined custom lists the settings do not carry over from the non-starred to the starred versions
%         SIGH !

\setlist{itemjoin={\hspace{0.5cm}}}%                     bit of space as joiner for the inline version

\def\enumerateWithDots{
  \setlist[enumerate]{
    partopsep=1.0\parskip,  % separation added when the preceding is a paragraph
    topsep=-0.5\parskip,    % separation added when the preceding is only a line with no paragraph ending
    itemsep=0cm,
    label=\textbf{(\arabic*)},
    after={\vspace*{1.5\parskip}}
  }
}

\def\enumerateWithBrackets{
  \setlist[enumerate]{
    partopsep=1.0\parskip,  % separation added when the preceding is a paragraph
    topsep=-0.5\parskip,    % separation added when the preceding is only a line with no paragraph ending
    itemsep=0cm,
    label=\textbf{(\arabic*)},
    after={\vspace*{1.5\parskip}}
  }
}

\enumerateWithBrackets


%% define enumerated as dotted version should we nevertheless need it.
\newlist{enumerated}{enumerate}{3}\setlist[enumerated]{topsep=0pt,itemsep=0cm,label=\textbf{\arabic*.}}  
\newlist{enumerated*}{enumerate*}{3}\setlist[enumerated*]{topsep=0pt,itemsep=0cm,label=\textbf{\arabic*.}} % need that since for custom lists the * automatism does not work

\setlist[itemize]{
  partopsep=1.0\parskip,
  topsep=-0.5\parskip,
  itemsep=0cm
}

\setlist[description]{itemindent=-1.5em, labelsep=0pt,partopsep=\parskip,topsep=-\parskip}



%%
%% TABLES and ARRAYS
%%

\usepackage{array}%                       load the new array package

\arraycolsep=3.0pt%                       adds to the separation of array columns
\def\arraystretch{1.2}%                   increase the distance between rows of an array

\usepackage{adjustbox}%   used for alignment https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/127056/vertical-alignment-of-graphic-and-tabular

\usepackage{marginnote}
\def\mymarg#1{\hspace*{-6cm}\marginnote{#1}}






%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%% FONTS
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%\usepackage{concmath}
%\usepackage[OT1]{fontenc}
%\usepackage{txfonts}

\usepackage{stix}                  % needed for \operp and similar symbols
\usepackage{stmaryrd}              % needed for \bigsqcap
\usepackage{fontawesome}           % make fontawesome with some additional symbols available, for example \faTV etc
\usepackage{wasysym}               % some symbols
\usepackage{eurosym}               % euro symbol



%%
%% SHORTCUTS
%%
\def\be{\begin{equation}}
\def\ee{\end{equation}}



% add shortcut for roman literals
\makeatletter
\newcommand{\rmnum}[1]{\romannumeral #1}
\newcommand{\Rmnum}[1]{\expandafter\@slowromancap\romannumeral #1@}
\makeatother



\def\proof#1#2#3{\prooftree #1 \justifies #2 \thickness=0.04em \using #3 \endprooftree}




\usepackage{soul}                                     % defines strikeout markup   \st{strike out}


%%%
%%% SYMBOLS
%%%



%% MediaWiki:ParsifalInclude/LaTeXSymbols


\newcommand\independent{\protect\mathpalette{\protect\independenT}{\perp}}
\def\independenT#1#2{\mathrel{\rlap{$#1#2$}\mkern2mu{#1#2}}}


\def\vv#1{\overrightarrow{#1}} 
\def\vvplus{\vec{+}}

\def\commutes{\leftrightarrow}



\def\with{\|}

\def\leaves{\spadesuit}                     % Leaves of a tree etc...
\def\interleave{ \mid \mid \mid }   


\def\con{ \mbox{\^{ }}}                     % Concatenation
\def\sts#1{\stackrel{#1}{\longrightarrow}}  % State Transition System
\def\stss#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_*} % with a star
\def\stsp#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_+} % with a plus
\def\stsc#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_\circ} % with a circle
\def\stsh#1{\stackrel{#1}{ {\longrightarrow } }_h} % with a h
\def\pre#1{ {^\bullet #1} }                 % preset in Petri Nets
\def\post#1{ {#1 ^ \bullet} }               % postset in Petri Nets
\def\Me{\mbox{Me}}                          % Me (X,Y) Symbol
\def\bottom{\bot}
\def\with{\mid}

\def\error{\dagger}                          % error symbol error algebras
\def\im{{\cal I}}                            % image of a partial function
\def\nin{\not\in}



\def\negil{\kern-.13em }
\def\negir{\kern-.08em }
\def\LB{[\negil[}
\def\RB{]\negir]}

\def\1{\mbox{{\bf 1}}}
\def\0{\mbox{{\bf 0}}}
\def\T{\mbox{{\bf T}}}
\def\F{\mbox{{\bf F}}}

%%
%% SETS and FUNCTIONS
%%

\def\N{{\Bbb N}}
\def\Q{{\Bbb Q}}
\def\Z{{\Bbb Z}}
\def\K{{\Bbb K}}
\def\R{{\Bbb R}}
\def\C{{\Bbb C}}


%%
%% Specific mathematical arrows
%%

\def\pto{\rightharpoonup}            % partial function:  f: A \pto B
\def\inclusion{\hookrightarrow}      % inclusion, or more general: injective function   f: A \inclusion B

\def\ito{\hookrightarrow}        % inclusion function
\def\pto{\leadsto}               % partially defined function


\def\lins{{\text{\bf Lin}_s}}    % stetige lineare Abbildungen

\def\tr{\text{\bf Tr}}           % spur operator
\def\ker{\text{\bf Kern}}        % Kernel of a linear map
\def\im{\text{\bf Im}}           % Image of a linear map
\def\eig{\text{\bf Eig}}         % Eigenspace of a linear map

\def\norm#1{\| #1 \|}            % norm

%%
%% Pseudocode
%%
 
\def\tIF{\mbox{\tt \ if }}
\def\tTHEN{\mbox{\tt \ then }}
\def\tELSE{\mbox{\tt \ else }}
\def\tFI{\mbox{\tt \ fi }}
\def\tWHILE{\mbox{\tt \ while }}
\def\tDO{\mbox{\tt \ do }}
\def\tREPEAT{\mbox{\tt \ repeat }}
\def\tUNTIL{\mbox{\tt \ until }}

%% 
%% Category Theory
%% 
\def\M{{\frak M}}                       % Morphisms of a category
\def\O{{\frak O}}                       % Objects of a category

\def\codom{\mbox{\textbf{Codom}}}       % Codomain
\def\dom{\mbox{\textbf{Dom}}}           % Domain
\def\Hom{\mbox{\textbf{Hom}}}           % Hom functor

\def\hto{\twoheadrightarrow}
\def\htot{\rightarrowtail}
\def\smallbox{[\hspace*{-0.02cm}]}      % Non-deterministic choice in guarded command language

\def\clolli{{\>\mathbin\multimap\>}}
\def\illolc{{\>\mathbin{\circ\! -}\>}}

\def\before{\mathbin\succeq} 
\def\prebefore{\mathbin{\vec{\succ}}}
\def\extendsto{\mathbin\trianglerighteq}
\def\extendstoim{\mathbin{\vec{\triangleright}}}


\def\trans{\longrightarrow}
\def\transa#1{\stackrel{#1}{\trans}}
\def\transb#1#2{\stackrel{#1}{\trans_#2}}

\def\proof#1#2#3{\prooftree #1 \justifies #2 \thickness=0.04em \using #3 \endprooftree}

\def\entails{\vdash}


\def\tbone#1{\hbox to 5cm{#1}}

\def\THEN{\Rightarrow}
\def\IFF{\Leftrightarrow}



%%%
%%% LEGACY STUFF
%%%
\newcounter{myc}
\newenvironment{mitemize}%
  {\begin{list}{\arabic{myc}.}{\usecounter{myc}\setlength{\topsep}{0pt}}%
    \setlength{\itemsep}{0pt}%
    \setlength{\parskip}{\parskip}}%
  {\end{list}}
  
\newenvironment{menumerate}%
  {\begin{list}{\arabic{myc}.}{\usecounter{myc}\setlength{\topsep}{0pt}}%
    \setlength{\itemsep}{0pt}%
    \setlength{\parskip}{\parskip}}%
  {\end{list}}  
%%%
%%%  END OF TWEAK ITEMIZATIONS
%%%

\def\ubf#1{\underline{\textbf{#1}}}

%%
%% SPACING MACROS
%%

\def\tab{\hspace*{0.7cm}}
\def\n{\break}

\def\up{\vspace*{-\parskip}}          % go up one parskip

\def\mleft{\hspace*{-\mathindent}}    % go left one mathindent space
\def\mright{\hspace*{\mathindent}}    % go right one mathindent space

\def\qquad{\quad\quad}                % double quad
\def\qqquad{\quad\quad\quad}          % triple quad
\def\qqqauad{\quad\quad\quad\quad}    % quadruple quad

%%
%% STRUCTURAL MACROS
%%

\def\title#1{\textbf{\large #1}}

This page is a system page. It controls what is shown in the Categories portion of the sidebar. The contents of this page must conform to the following rules: * The page contains a single <pre> ... </pre> area. * This area contains a JSON data string of type array. * The array contains objects of one of the following types: ** {"root": , "depth": } ** {"name": } ** Every object may contain an optional "style" key whose value is a CSS string. ** Every object may contain an optional "classname" field whose value refers to a class name known to the system 
[
  {"root": "Root", "depth":4},
  {"name": "Example", "style": "color:red;"},
  {"name": "Testpage", "style": "color:green;"}
]
